summary: Blocking: the required Continuous Improvement Auditor report for the recorded marker timestamp is not present in docs/self-improvement/reports and therefore cannot satisfy merge guardrails. Additional concerns: session capture is missing (marker has session_id/session_console null), and the working tree is dirty with an uncommitted update to docs/agents/subagent-registry.json.

issues.root_cause: After recording the marker (docs/self-improvement/markers/feature-subagent-exec-default.json), no corresponding auditor JSON report was created and committed under docs/self-improvement/reports for that marker timestamp.
issues.mitigation: Generate the auditor JSON report for marker timestamp 2026-01-23T04:19:02.637090+00:00, save it to docs/self-improvement/reports/feature-subagent-exec-default--2026-01-23T04:19:02.637090+00:00.json, and commit it on feature/subagent-exec-default.
issues.prevention: Make the turn-end/merge workflow enforce existence + commit of docs/self-improvement/reports/<branch>--<marker-timestamp>.json before proceeding past marker creation (hard gate).
issues.evidence: docs/self-improvement/markers/feature-subagent-exec-default.json contains timestamp 2026-01-23T04:19:02.637090+00:00; docs/progress/feature-subagent-exec-default.md explicitly lists 'run the Continuous Improvement Auditor and commit the JSON report for the marker timestamp' as Next Actions; docs/self-improvement/reports contained no entries for feature-subagent-exec-default at audit time.

issues.root_cause: The marker file indicates no session capture was recorded for the audited turn (session_id/session_console are null), reducing traceability of commands and outputs for retrospective review.
issues.mitigation: Ensure sessions are started for the branch so marker files include session_id and session_console metadata (capture shell transcript/console where applicable).
issues.prevention: Add a guardrail check when recording markers to warn/fail if session_id is null unless explicitly acknowledged in progress logs.

issues.root_cause: Running subagent workflows updated the tracked file docs/agents/subagent-registry.json, but the change was not committed (and not mentioned in the branch progress log) at audit time.
issues.mitigation: Decide whether docs/agents/subagent-registry.json updates are intended to be committed; if not, restore it so the working tree stays clean for merge-gated steps.
issues.prevention: Automate subagent-registry hygiene (auto-restore before merge gates or keep the registry out of tracked files) and enforce clean git status before review/merge gates.
issues.evidence: The auditor observed git status reporting a modified docs/agents/subagent-registry.json entry for the retro-audit run.

follow_ups: Create and commit docs/self-improvement/reports/feature-subagent-exec-default--2026-01-23T04:19:02.637090+00:00.json to satisfy the retrospective merge gate.
Ensure session artifacts are captured so future marker files include session_id/session_console (or explicitly acknowledge missing session capture).
Resolve uncommitted docs/agents/subagent-registry.json changes promptly (commit if intended, or restore).
